page.title: 05FARMING SCRAPTOFT THURNBY
page.content: The valley is farmed by four farmers and there is also a Nursery Garden and a Rose Garden in the district.The four farms which we visited are quite different and provide an interesting contrast.Redvers Farm in the east is mainly a sheep farm.New Ingarsby Farm is owned by a local dairy and concentrates entirely on milk production.Scraptoft Hill Farm produces seed corn but does have sheep and cattle for beef production. Keyham High Leas is a mixed farm run by a traditional farmer.A local builder also farms land near the estates.Planning permission has now been given for building and work has now begun.This has been opposed by existing residents who will lose their country views.Locals also object to hedges being removed, and medieval strip farmland being ploughed over.
